scenes.title: Three-front war and the new moat
scenes.main_point: AI raised expectations, broke distribution, and intensified competition—so growth shifted to trust.
scenes.scene_summary: AI raised expectations, collapsed channels, and intensified competition, so growth depended on trust.
key_elements: Three-front war: expectations, distribution collapse, value-prop attacks
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
A startup founder stands at a whiteboard in a small office, drawing three converging arrows labeled expectations, distribution collapse, and value-prop attacks, with “AI” pushing them forward.
They underline “TRUST” as a new moat, looking focused and determined.

scenes.title: Trust-based acquisition replaces broken channels
scenes.main_point: SEO/SEM/corporate social weakened; trust-driven channels like people, creators, community, and product experience worked.
scenes.scene_summary: SEO, SEM, and corporate social weakened, while people, creators, community, and product built trust.
key_elements: SEO disrupted by AI content and answer engines
SEM costs rose as searches stagnated and AI tools competed
Corporate social throttled links and demanded costly creative
Community-driven growth and word of mouth
Product-led brand: brand came from product experience
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
In a simple office whiteboard area, a marketer crosses out “SEO/SEM/Corporate Social” on a funnel chart while teammates point to “people, creators, community, product experience” as the new path.
A creator and an employee share a post on a phone, and a small “Cello referrals” note sits beside the word-of-mouth arrow, implying renewed trust.

scenes.title: Trust-based retention becomes the growth system
scenes.main_point: AI commoditized cost/efficiency value props; retention and operations required compounding trust through product and org velocity.
scenes.scene_summary: As AI commoditized utility, retention came from roadmap transparency, fast iteration, WOW UX, and aligned pricing.
key_elements: Value prop triad: cheaper, more efficient, more effective
AI beat many SaaS on cost and speed; commoditization risk
Trust defined as confidence the team kept delivering better outcomes
Trust builders: real roadmap visibility, feedback-driven shipping, WOW moments, thoughtful comms, outcome-aligned monetization
Operational shift: break silos, optimize velocity, ship micro-releases, build in public via real people
Trust compounded; channels and value props collapsed faster than expected
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
A SaaS product team and a customer sit together in a simple office, looking at a shared roadmap board labeled “micro-releases” and “feedback shipped,” while an “AI cheaper/faster” sign fades in the background.
They point to recent updates and aligned pricing notes, conveying calm confidence and growing trust.
